alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:44PM EDT until May 06 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHWESTERN HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 544 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Harrogate to 7 miles northeast of Tazewell to 9 miles northwest of Bean Station, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Harrogate, Cumberland Gap, Ewing and Powell River Preserve. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east Tennessee...and southwestern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
